Generation I.Red: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
Generation I.Yellow: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost perfect copy of its opponent.
Generation I.Stadium: Capable of reorganizing its cells to transform into an exact duplicate of its enemy. It is usually a shapeless blob.

Generation II.Gold: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.
Generation II.Silver: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.
Generation II.Crystal: When it encounters another Ditto , it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pok é mon manages to get details wrong.
Generation III.Sapphire: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pok é mon manages to get details wrong.
Generation III.Emerald: A Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself. However, if it tries to change based on its memory, it will get details wrong.
Generation III.FireRed: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Capable of copying an opponent's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

Generation IV.Diamond: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation IV.Pearl: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation IV.Platinum: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

Generation V.Black: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation V.White: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation V.Black 2: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
Generation V.White 2: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

Generation VI.X: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation VI.Y: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.

Generation VII.Sun: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
Generation VII.Moon: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto apparently has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transformations.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It transforms into whatever it sees. If the thing it's transforming into isn't right in front of it, Ditto relies on its memory—so sometimes it fails.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.

Generation VIII.Sword: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
Generation VIII.Shield: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.
Generation IX.Violet: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
